knimeNode.name: Amazon S3 Connector (Labs)
knimeNode.shortDescription: Provides a file system connection to Amazon S3.

intro.p: This node configures the connection information that will be used to connect to Amazon S3. Using this connection the other KNIME remote file handling nodes such as Excel Reader and Excel Writer can download and upload files from and to Amazon S3.
For further documentation please take a look at the AWS Documentation.

Path syntax: Paths for Amazon S3 are specified with a UNIX-like syntax, /mybucket/myfolder/myfile. An absolute for S3 consists of:
A leading slash ("/").
Followed by the name of a bucket ("mybucket" in the above example), followed by a slash.
Followed by the name of an object within the bucket ("myfolder/myfile" in the above example).

tab.name: Settings
tab.option: Specifies the working directory using the path syntax explained above. The working directory must be specified as an absolute path. A working directory allows downstream nodes to access files/folders using relative paths, i.e. paths that do not have a leading slash. If not specified, the default working directory is "/".

Determines if the path normalization should be applied. Path normalization eliminates redundant components of a path like, e.g. /a/../b/./c" can be normalized to "/b/c". When these redundant components like "../" or "." are part of an existing object, then normalization must be deactivated in order to access them properly.

tab.name: Advanced
tab.option: The socket read/write timeout. For further details see the S3 documentation.

ports.inPort: Port object containing the AWS connection information.
